lead_paragraph: The defending champion Fabrice Santoro advanced to the final of the Hall of Fame Tennis Championships in Newport, R.I., by beating Vince Spadea, 7-6 (4), 6-1. Santoro, 35, and Spadea, 33, had the oldest combined age in a semifinal on tour since 1993, when 31-year old Brad Gilbert beat 40-year old Jimmy Connors in San Francisco.
